mCode > Terminology

Terminology

Value dimension

Libraries’ ability to develop a shared vision, goal and mission on community data services, adopting changes to revise them when necessary.

Organizational culture

The values, beliefs, attitudes, and systems that influence employee behavior within an organization.

ALA

Core values of librarianship include access, equity, intellectual freedom and privacy, public good, and sustainability.

Data ethics

Evaluates data practices related to collecting, analyzing, and disseminating data in order safeguard against potential to harm impact people and society, through those practices.

Local library mission

Relates to the specific mission of the individual libraries.

Internal data capacity dimension

Internal data skills use to support decisions about library resources and services and to potentially support community data services.

Infrastructure

Basic resources needed for library operations.

Human resources

Dimension–libraries’ ability to deploy human capital. This dimension not only includes librarians’ competencies, skills and knowledge related to community data services, but also librarians’ attitudes, motivation and behaviors that influence both the organizational culture and the community data services.

Administration

Dimension (Organizational infrastructure)–libraries’ ability to develop and draw on their daily management, workflow, strategic plans, and policies to support community data services.

Finances

Dimension–libraries’ ability to deploy financial capital for sustainably supporting community data services, including revenues, expenses and assets.

Technology

Infrastructure dimension–libraries’ ability to deploy or rely on their technical resources related to community data service operations.

Data access dimension

The delivery of data to library staff and/or community members through the existing library system’s infrastructure.

Community data

As the data that describe the local context and are used for community decision-making.

Open Data

Considered as data that are accessible, machine-readable, free (or available at negligible cost), and have minimal limitations on their use.

Internal Data

Is data generated and collected to describe the use of library resources and services.

Programming & Instruction Dimension

Programming

Provide programming that uses data to inform your community.

Instruction

Support communities’ data utilization through data instruction such as literacy education.

Community Context Dimension

Is the context which informs public library resources and services.

Networking

The process of interacting with others to exchange information and ideas to develop relationships to further common goals.

UN sustainable Development Goals

It is a call to action to end poverty and other depravations to improve health and education, reduce inequality, and spur economic growth.

Local community’s needs

These are needs that emerge given a unique set economic, environmental, and social circumstances.
